dict.string: A technology that superimposes a computer-generated image on a user's view of the real world.
A computer graphic that may be moved on-screen and otherwise manipulated as a single entity.
A SpriteKit node is an object you can place in your SpriteKit scene. These can range from images to background music and encompass a wide variety of functionality.
A SpriteKit scene is an easy to use canvas that you can place "nodes" in, which can represent characters or objects in your game. A SpriteKit scene is essentially a level in a game.
Variables are values that can be changed and stored for later use. For example, if we have a variable called name, we can set it to some text: name = "YourNameHere"
Functions are pieces of code used to perform actions on the screen. For example, if we have a function called addPlayer, we can type `addPlayer()` to run the code inside that function.
